result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacie L Brelove was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine ($389) and DNA surcharge are to be paid at $25 per month commencing 06-30-2015 and the 30th of each month thereafter or serve 12 days jail with huber as penalty for failure to pay fine/surcharge.

DNA surcharge ($200) to be paid inclusive of fine payment plan.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacie L Brelove

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Stacie L Brelove
Current: 10142 W. Jonen St., Milwaukee, WI 53224 United States  (Effective: 07-24-2015)
Prior: 2637 N. 36th St., Milwaukee, WI 53210
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Stacie L Brelove in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.


Court orders the following:
Fine:  $389
DNA Sample (if not already provided ) and Surcharge:  $ 200
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to pay at the rate of $25 per month, starting 06/30/15 and the 30th of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  12 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Stacie L Brelove in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the complaint, except if she has to contact them regarding a payroll check.
